cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida and 40 miles N of Varadero, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northwest through the Straits of Florida, forecast to track along the southwest and west coast of Florida, then inland toward the Florida Panhandle and southern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys (near Key West) early Sunday, then a second landfall near Naples / Marco Island late Sunday

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the entire Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including Tampa Bay; Storm Surge Warning South Santee River SC southward around Florida peninsula to Ochlockonee River and Tampa Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Very high likelihood (90% cumulative) of sustained 50-kt winds with hurricane-force gusts possible; 68% chance of 64-kt (hurricane-force) winds at the port within 36 h.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC surge guidance indicates 5–8 ft of inundation possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain possible in west-central Florida leading to life-threatening flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes embedded in rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
